Ok if one can not be a samurai and ninja where samurai how can there be ninjitsu?Michael 
 
Youngblood <warrior02@...> wrote:
My only question is this: is it the same
person/people as those who created the site, or is it
someone making their own spinoff to the saga?

That indeed is a good question and you are probably right. I realize the
site and the book is a parody, I have another word for it, but I would like
to keep it G Rated here.

I was merely answering the question that he was a child. 

Mike
-------Original Message-------

From: Nate Ledbetter
Date: 05/30/05 23:54:04
To: samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Re: Ninja Masters of America


--- Michael Youngblood <warrior02@...> wrote:
> If you do find a legit article I would very muck
> like to see it. This was
> the only article I've seen, and I had to hunt that
> one down. I was mistaken
> that it was CNN. when it was MSNBC, for that I
> apologize. 

You had to hunt it down, because it's not REAL. It's
hosted off the UCLA website, which leads me to believe
it's the creation of one or more UCLA students, as a
joke. NOTHING comes up on the MSNBC site if you look
for anything related to this. 

Not only is the website a parody, but all this
business about being in court and defecating is ALSO a
parody/joke. My only question is this: is it the same
person/people as those who created the site, or is it
someone making their own spinoff to the saga?

*sigh*

And people get upset when I lament the failure of
today's youth to grasp irony...
